  • public final class HTMLFormat
extends Format<Document>
    HTML body format.

    • Field Summary

      The default MIME type for HTML message bodies ("text/html").

      A pattern matching the HTML MIME type.

      • html

        public static HTMLFormat html()

      • html

        public static Result<Document,Exception> html(Reader reader,
                                              String base)
        Parses an HTML document.
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader the HTML document is to be parsed from
        base - the base URL for the HTML document to be parsed
        Returns:
        a value result containing the parsed HTML document, if reader was successfully parsed; an error result containg the parse exception, otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null

      • html

        public static <W extends Writer> Result<W,Exception> html(W writer,
                                                          String base,
                                                          Document document)
        Writes an HTML document.
        Type Parameters:
        W - the type of the writer the HTML document is to be written to
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer the HTML document is to be written to
        base - the base URL for the HTML document to be written
        document - the HTML document to be written
        Returns:
        a value result containing the target writer, if document was successfully written; an error result containg the write exception, otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null

      • get

        public Result<Document,Failure> get(Message<?> message)
        Description copied from class: Format
        Retrieves a body representation from a message.

        Processing failure should be reported using the following HTTP status codes:

        • Response.UnsupportedMediaType for missing bodies;
        • Response.BadRequest for malformed bodies, unless a more specific status code is available.

        The default implementation returns a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, unless explicitly overridden.

        Overrides:
        get in class Format<Document>
        Parameters:
        message - the message whose body representation managed by this body format is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the optional HTML body representation of message, as retrieved from the reader supplied by its ReaderFormat representation, if one is present and the value of the Content-Type header is MIME; a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, otherwise

      • set

        public <M extends Message<M>> M set(M message,
                                    Document value)
        Configures the WriterFormat representation of message to write the HML value to the writer supplied by the accepted writer and sets the Content-Type header to "text/html", unless already defined.
        Overrides:
        set in class Format<Document>
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of message
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be configured to hold a body representation managed by this body format
        value - the body representation being configured for message by this body format
        Returns:
        the configured message
